info.description: This document serves as the draft documentation for the OpenDSR API, designed for energy traders, DSOs, aggregators, and energy service providers to manage and interact with different OEMs smart grid-capable devices using a single API. It enables aggregators to effectively manage the devices' load and incorporate Demand Side Response (DSR) strategies to optimize energy usage and cost efficiency.
info.title: OpenDSR

tags.name: Charging Schedules
tags.description: Control the charging session for a specific charger.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhooks allow you to receive real-time notifications when certain events occur, such as device telemetry updates or device status changes. To use webhooks, you must configure a webhook URL where OpenDSR API will send HTTP POST requests with the event data.

tags.name: Telemetry
tags.description: Telemetry data allows users to transmit real-time telemetry data from devices.

get.description:
This endpoint retrieves a comprehensive list of devices associated with the authenticated user's account. The response includes essential device information such as ID, type, model, and status, giving users a clear overview of their devices' details and current state. It serves as a starting point for third parties to manage and interact with users' devices through other API endpoints.

This API now includes site-based segregation, allowing users to manage their devices more effectively when they have devices across multiple sites. Each site has its own ID, name, and optional grid limit, and the devices within the site are listed under the site details.

This endpoint retrieves the latest telemetry data for a specific device, providing a comprehensive snapshot of its current status, power usage, and other relevant information. This allows 3rd parties to closely monitor and understand the performance and behaviour of a userâ€™s device, enabling more effective management and decision-making regarding their energy usage.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Device ID of the specific device.

post.description:
This endpoint allows 3rd parties to execute various commands on a specific device. The **`commandType`** field in the request body will define the type of command to be executed.

To start charging a specific device, the request should include the **`commandType`** as 'START_CHARGING' and specify the amount of energy to be delivered during the charging period. This allows for precise control when activating a particular device for charging.

For added flexibility, the request can also include an optional 'chargeDuration' parameter. When provided, this parameter specifies the intended duration for the charging session, allowing energy providers to optimize the delivery of energy based on the duration and the energy amount.

parameters.name: Body Parameters
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the location to be retrieved.

energy.description: Amount of energy to be delivered during the charging period in watt-hours (Wh)

chargeDuration.description: Optional parameter that indicates the intended duration of the charging session in ISO-8601 date format (e.g., 'PT2H') (only applicable for START_CHARGING)

hvacTargetTemperature.description: Desired set temperature in degrees Celsius

waterHeatingTargetTemperature.description: Desired set temperature for water in degrees Celsius

hvacMode.description: Desired mode of the HVAC system

waterHeatingMode.description: Desired mode of the water heating system

thermostatMode.description: Preferred operational mode for the thermostat system

hemsMode.description: Preferred operational mode for the thermostat system

hvacFanSpeed.description: Optional parameter to define the fan speed. If not specified, the default fan speed setting will be used.

duration.description: Optional parameter indicating the duration for which the command should be enacted in ISO-8601 duration format (e.g., 'PT2H'). If not specified, the changes will remain until manually adjusted.

heatingSchedule.description: Optional field to stipulate a heating schedule

startTime.description: Start time rendered in HH:mm format, such as '06:00'

endTime.description: End time rendered in HH:mm format, such as '06:00'

thermostatSchedule.description: Optional field to outline a thermostat operating schedule

startTime.description: Start time rendered in HH:mm format, such as '06:00'

endTime.description: End time rendered in HH:mm format, such as '06:00'

priority.description: Optional parameter signifying the priority of the DSR event, where 1 is the highest and 10 is the lowest. Helps devices gauge the sense of urgency.

thresholdPercentage.description: Optional parameter indicating the minimum solar generation percentage before the command is enacted. For instance, if set to 60%, the device will prioritize solar power when solar generation is 60% or higher.

dischargeRate.description: Optional parameter suggesting the rate of battery discharge in kilowatts (kW). If omitted, the default battery discharge rate will be applied.

thresholdStateOfCharge.description: Optional parameter showing the minimum State of Charge (SoC) percentage for enacting the command. E.g., if set at 20%, the device will tap into the battery only if its SoC exceeds 20%.

200.description: The request was successful, and the command has been executed as instructed.

400.description: The request was invalid or could not be understood by the server. This might happen if a required parameter is missing or if a parameter is in an invalid format.

403.description: The requester is not authorized to execute the specified command on the given device. This could happen if the request comes from an unauthorized third party.

406.description: The specified device is not a charger (if commandType is START_CHARGING). This can occur if a device ID that does not correspond to a charger is provided.

429.description: The requester has exceeded their rate limit for the commands endpoint. This could happen if an excessive number of requests are made in a short period.

500.description: There was an internal server error while trying to process the request. This usually means that something has gone wrong on the server's side.

get.description: This endpoint allows 3rd parties to retrieve the charging schedule set for a specific device, providing insights into their planned charging periods and energy usage. This information can be useful for monitoring and adjusting the schedule to optimize energy consumption and costs.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Device ID of the specific device.

delete.description: This endpoint allows 3rd parties to delete a charging schedule set for a specific device, allowing them to modify or remove their energy management plans as needed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Device ID of the specific device.

post.description: Subscribe to specific events related to devices in order to receive real-time updates and notifications. This endpoint enables 3rd parties to monitor users' devices more effectively by receiving timely notifications whenever an event of interest, such as a state change or telemetry update, occurs. When an event is triggered, the webhook notification will be sent to the specified endpoint.

get.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of all active webhook subscriptions, providing 3rd parties with an overview of their current event monitoring setup. The response will include essential webhook information such as webhook ID, event type, webhook URL, and associated device ID, allowing 3rd parties to manage and track their webhook subscriptions effectively.

delete.description: This endpoint allows 3rd parties to unsubscribe from an active webhook, allowing them to stop receiving notifications for specific events when they are no longer needed or desired. Unsubscribing from a webhook can be useful when a 3rd party wants to reduce the number of notifications they receive or when monitoring certain events is no longer necessary.

post.description:
This endpoint allows devices to transmit real-time telemetry data for monitoring and analysis.

**Device types**

`HVAC_SYSTEM`: Allows HVAC systems to transmit real-time telemetry data for monitoring, control, and analysis. It covers information about the current operational status, temperature metrics, mode, fan speed, energy consumption, and maintenance alerts.

`WATER_HEATER`: Allows Water Heaters to transmit real-time telemetry data for monitoring, control, and analysis. It covers information about the current heating status, temperature metrics, status of the heating element, energy consumption, and water usage.

`THERMOSTAT`: Allows Thermostats to transmit real-time telemetry data for monitoring, control, and analysis. It encompasses details about the current heating or cooling status, room temperature, setpoint temperature, current humidity, and heating/cooling schedules.

`BATTERY_STORAGE`: Allows Battery Storage devices to transmit real-time telemetry data for monitoring, control, and analysis. It provides details about the charge status, total capacity, available energy, rate of energy input/output, number of charge cycles, internal temperature, and estimated battery health.

`SOLAR_INVERTER`: Permits Solar Inverters to send real-time telemetry data for monitoring, control, and analysis. It encompasses information about the operational status, power generation rate, total energy produced, DC and AC metrics, conversion efficiency, internal temperature, and sunlight intensity (if applicable).

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: ID corresponding to the device from which the telemetry data originates.

message.example: Invalid or missing data fields in the telemetry data.

get.description: This endpoint retrieves a comprehensive list of devices associated with the authenticated user's account. The response includes essential device information such as ID, type, model, and status, giving users a clear overview of their devices' details and current state. This API now includes location-based segregation, allowing users to manage their devices more effectively when they have devices across multiple locations. Each location has its own ID, name, and optional grid limit, and the devices within the location are listed under the location details.

name.description: Custom name given to the location by the user, allowing for easy identification and management

gridLimit.description: The maximum power that can be delivered through the grid in watts (W)

devices.description: The devices that's belongs under that location

post.description: This endpoint allows users to create a new location. The location represents a grouping of devices associated with a specific area, enabling users to organize and manage their devices effectively, especially when they have devices across multiple locations.

name.description: Custom name given to the location by the user, allowing for easy identification and management

gridLimit.description: The maximum power that can be delivered through the grid in watts (W)

devices.description: The devices that's belongs under that location

400.description: The request parameters or body were invalid or missing.

403.description: The user does not have permission to create a location.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

get.description: This endpoint allows users to retrieve a specific location based on the provided location ID. The location represents a grouping of devices associated with a specific area, enabling users to organize and manage their devices effectively, especially when they have devices across multiple locations.

parameters.name: locationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the location to be retrieved.

200.description: The location was successfully retrieved, and the response includes the location object.

name.description: Custom name given to the location by the user, allowing for easy identification and management

gridLimit.description: The maximum power that can be delivered through the grid in watts (W)

devices.description: The devices that's belongs under that location

403.description: The user does not have permission to access the location.

404.description: The specified location ID does not exist.

500.description: An error occurred on the server

put.description: This endpoint allows users to update an existing location. The location represents a grouping of devices associated with a specific area, enabling users to organize and manage their devices effectively, especially when they have devices across multiple locations.

200.description: The location was successfully retrieved, and the response includes the location object.

name.description: Custom name given to the location by the user, allowing for easy identification and management

gridLimit.description: The maximum power that can be delivered through the grid in watts (W)

devices.description: The devices that's belongs under that location

400.description: The request parameters or body were invalid or missing.

403.description: The user does not have permission to update the location.

404.description: The specified location ID does not exist.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

delete.description: By sending a DELETE request to this endpoint with the desired location ID, users can remove the location and its associated devices. Deleting a location will also remove any associations and configurations related to that location. **Description**: This endpoint allows users to delete a specific location on the provided location ID. The location represents a grouping of devices associated with a specific area, enabling users to organize and manage their devices effectively, especially when they have devices across multiple locations.

403.description: The user does not have permission to delete the location.

404.description: The specified location ID does not exist.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

post.description: This endpoint enables users to register (add) existing devices to a specific location. By associating multiple devices with a particular location, users can effectively manage and monitor their energy-related equipment in distinct areas.

devices.description: The devices that's should be removed from that location

201.description: Upon successful registration of the devices to the location, the response will be empty with no content returned.

400.description: The request parameters or body were invalid or missing.

403.description: The user does not have permission to register devices to the location.

404.description: The specified location ID or one or more device IDs do not exist.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

delete.description: This endpoint enables users to remove (unregister) existing devices from a specific location. By disassociating devices from a particular location, users can effectively manage their energy-related equipment across different locations.

devices.description: The devices that's should be removed from that location

201.description: Upon successful registration of the devices to the location, the response will be empty with no content returned.

400.description: The request parameters or body were invalid or missing.

403.description: The user does not have permission to register devices to the location.

404.description: The specified location ID or one or more device IDs do not exist.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

get.description: This endpoint retrieves the list of devices associated with a specific location identified by the provided location ID. The response includes essential device information such as ID, type, model, and status, giving users a clear overview of the devices' details and current state within the specified location.

200.description: The list of devices associated with the specified location was successfully retrieved.

403.description: The user does not have permission to access devices for the location.

404.description: The specified location ID does not exist.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

post.description:
This endpoint allows 3rd parties to execute various commands at a specific location. The commandType field in the request body will define the type of command to be executed.

### Commands

201.description: Upon successful registration of the devices to the location, the response will be empty with no content returned.

400.description: The request parameters or body were invalid or missing.

403.description: The user does not have permission to register devices to the location.

404.description: The specified location ID or one or more device IDs do not exist.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

delete.description: This endpoint allows 3rd parties to delete an existing charging schedule for a specific location. This feature is important for adjusting energy usage based on changes in the user's needs and preferences. Once deleted, the device will revert to its default charging schedule unless a new one is set.

parameters.name: locationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the location for which devices' schedule needs to be deleted.

204.description: The charging schedule was successfully deleted.

400.description: The request parameters were invalid or missing.

401.description: The user is not authenticated or does not have permission to delete the charging schedule.

403.description: The user does not have permission to delete the charging schedule for the location.

404.description: The specified location ID does not exist or no schedule exists for the given location.

406.description: The specified location does not have any chargers. This can occur if a location ID that does not have associated chargers is provided.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

get.description: This endpoint allows 3rd parties to retrieve a set charging schedule for a specific device. This is essential for tracking energy usage and confirming the settings that are in place. The response will include details of the schedule, such as start time, end time, and the amount of energy to be delivered during the charging period.

200.description: The list of devices associated with the specified location was successfully retrieved.

400.description: The request parameters were invalid or missing.

401.description: The user is not authenticated or does not have permission to retrieve the charging schedule.

403.description: The user does not have permission to retrieve the charging schedule for the location.

404.description: The specified location ID does not exist.

406.description: The specified location does not have any chargers. This can occur if a location ID that does not have associated chargers is provided.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

post.description: This endpoint enables administrators or authorized users to link another user. By linking users, administrators can grant access and permissions to the EMS system, allowing the linked users to monitor and manage devices and locations.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user

201.description: The user was successfully linked to the EMS account.

400.description: The request parameters or body were invalid or missing.

401.description: The user is not authenticated or does not have permission to link users.

403.description: The user does not have permission to link users.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

delete.description: This endpoint enables administrators or authorized users to unlink a user. By unlinking users, administrators can revoke access and permissions to the EMS system, preventing the unlinked users from accessing devices and locations.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user

201.description: The user was successfully linked to the EMS account.

400.description: The request parameters or body were invalid or missing.

401.description: The user is not authenticated or does not have permission to link users.

403.description: The user does not have permission to link users.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

get.description: This endpoint enables administrators or authorized users to retrieve information about a user. By querying this endpoint with a user's unique identifier (user ID), administrators can access the user's details.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user

200.description: The user details were successfully retrieved.

401.description: The user is not authenticated or does not have permission to retrieve user details.

403.description: The user does not have permission to retrieve user details.

404.description: The specified user ID does not exist or is not associated with the EMS account.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

get.description: This endpoint allows administrators or authorized users to retrieve the list of location IDs associated with a specific user. By querying this endpoint with the user's unique identifier (user ID), administrators can access the location IDs to which the user has access.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user

200.description: The user details were successfully retrieved.

401.description: The user is not authenticated or does not have permission to access user information.

403.description: The user does not have permission to access user information.

404.description: The specified user ID does not exist or is not associated with the EMS account.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

get.description: This endpoint enables administrators or authorized users to retrieve the list of device IDs associated with a specific user. By querying this endpoint with the user's unique identifier (user ID), administrators can access the device IDs that are connected to the user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user for whom device IDs need to be retrieved.

200.description: The list of device IDs associated with the specified user was successfully retrieved.

401.description: The user is not authenticated or does not have permission to access user information.

403.description: The user does not have permission to access user information.

404.description: The specified user ID does not exist or is not associated with any devices.

500.description: An error occurred on the server.

name.description: Custom name given to the site by the user, allowing for easy identification and management

gridLimit?.description: The maximum power that can be delivered through the grid in watts (W)

deviceType.description: Type of the device, such as vehicle charger, energy diverter, battery, or other

vendor.description: The OEM which created the device

model.description: Specific product model corresponding to the device type and vendor

description.description: A brief description of the device, such as its features or purpose

alias.description: Custom name given to the device by the user, allowing for easy identification and management

status.description: Current operational status of the device: active (operating normally), inactive (not in use or turned off), or faulted (malfunctioning or error state)

powerLimit.description: (Optional) The maximum power limit a user has set for the device in watts (W)

deviceType.description: Type of the device, such as vehicle charger, energy diverter, battery, or other

vendor.description: The OEM which created the device

model.description: Specific product model corresponding to the device type and vendor

description.description: A brief description of the device, such as its features or purpose

alias.description: Custom name given to the device by the user, allowing for easy identification and management

powerLimit.description: The maximum power limit a user has set for the device in watts (W)

timestamp.description: Date and time of the data point in ISO-8601 format (e.g., '2023-05-10T14:48:00.000Z')

status.description: Current operational status of the device: active (operating normally), inactive (not in use or turned off), or faulted (malfunctioning or error state)

state.description: Current state of the charging process: no vehicle connected, waiting for surplus energy, actively charging, charge complete, or faulted

actualPower.description: Actual active power reading at the timestamp in watts (W)

gridPower.description: Active power drawn from the grid in watts (W); can be used to calculate the proportion of green power

averagePower.description: Average of active power over the interval in watts (W)

interval.description: Duration of the interval in seconds that the data point covers

energyDelivered.description: Amount of energy delivered during the interval in watt-hours (Wh)

sessionEnergy.description: Amount of energy delivered to the vehicle since the start of the charging session (when plugged in) in watt-hours (Wh)

boostCharge.description: Indicates if the customer has overridden the schedule and is boost charging the battery (true) or following the schedule (false)

faultType.description: Optional property describing the type of fault, if any, affecting the charging process

chargeDelayOverride.description: Indicates if the 3rd party wants to override the random charge delay required by regulations, available only for authorized energy suppliers

startTime.description: Start time of the charging period in ISO-8601 date format (e.g., '2023-05-10T14:48:00.000Z')

endTime.description: End time of the charging period in ISO-8601 date format (e.g., '2023-05-10T16:48:00.000Z')

energy.description: Amount of energy to be delivered during the charging period in watt-hours (Wh)

deviceStatus.description: Current operational status of the device: active (operating normally), inactive (not in use or turned off), or faulted (malfunctioning or error state)

deviceSupplyMode.description: Mode of energy supply: green-preferred (maximize green energy use), green-only (limit use of grid power), schedule (charge based on user-defined schedule), fast (charge as quickly as possible), or stop (stops all charging)

eventType.description: Type of event that occurred: state_change (triggers whenever a device state changes), telemetry (triggers whenever there is a data update from the device), or device_change (triggers when a device is removed or a new one is added)

endpoint.description: The URL to receive the webhook notification when the event occurs

deviceId.description: Unique identifier for the device associated with the event

deviceType.description: Specifies the type of device sending the telemetry.

hvacStatus.description:
Current operational status of the HVAC system.

Required for `deviceType: 'HVAC_SYSTEM'`

thermostatStatus.description:
Current operational status of the Thermostat.

Required for `deviceType: 'THERMOSTAT'`

waterHeaterStatus.description:
Current operational status of the Water Heater.

Required for `deviceType: 'WATER_HEATER'`

solarInverterStatus.description:
Current operational status of the solar inverter.

Required for `deviceType: 'SOLAR_INVERTER'`

chargeStatus.description:
Current charging status of the battery.

Required for `deviceType: 'BATTERY_STORAGE'`

hvacCurrentTemperature.description:
Present room temperature or the desired setting in Celsius.

Required for `deviceType: 'HVAC_SYSTEM'`

waterHeaterCurrentTemperature.description:
Present temperature of the water in Celsius.

Required for `deviceType: 'WATER_HEATER'`

currentRoomTemperature.description:
Real-time ambient room temperature in Celsius.

Required for `deviceType: 'THERMOSTAT'`

batteryTemperature.description:
Real-time internal battery temperature in Celsius.

Required for `deviceType: 'BATTERY_STORAGE'`

batteryHealth.description:
Estimated lifespan or health percentage of the battery (0-100).

Required for `deviceType: 'BATTERY_STORAGE'`

hvacSetpoint.description:
Desired temperature settings for heating or cooling in Celsius.

Required for `deviceType: 'HVAC_SYSTEM'`

thermostatSetpoint.description:
Desired room temperature setting in Celsius.

Required for `deviceType: 'THERMOSTAT'`

waterHeaterSetpoint.description:
Desired water temperature setting in Celsius.

Required for `deviceType: 'WATER_HEATER'`

capacity.description:
Total battery storage capacity measured in kWh.

Required for `deviceType: 'BATTERY_STORAGE'`

heatingElementStatus.description:
Operational status of the heating element.

Required for `deviceType: 'WATER_HEATER'`

hvacMode.description:
Operational mode of the HVAC system.

Required for `deviceType: 'HVAC_SYSTEM'`

hvacFanSpeed.description:
Speed of the HVAC system fan.

Required for `deviceType: 'HVAC_SYSTEM'`

hvacEnergyUsage.description:
Total energy consumed by the HVAC system in kWh.

Required for `deviceType: 'HVAC_SYSTEM'`

waterHeaterEnergyUsage.description:
Total energy consumed by the Water Heater in kWh.

Required for `deviceType: 'WATER_HEATER'`

availableEnergy.description:
The amount of energy currently available for use, measured in kWh.

Required for `deviceType: 'BATTERY_STORAGE'`

inputOutputRate.description:
Rate at which energy is being charged or discharged, measured in kW.

Required for `deviceType: 'BATTERY_STORAGE'`

chargeCycles.description:
Total number of complete charge and discharge cycles the battery has undergone.

Required for `deviceType: 'BATTERY_STORAGE'`

waterUsage.description:
Amount of water used or heated, specified in litres or gallons.

Required for `deviceType: 'WATER_HEATER'`

hvacMaintenanceAlerts.description:
A list of maintenance alerts like filter change reminders, detected issues, etc.

Required for `deviceType: 'HVAC_SYSTEM'`

humidity.description:
Current indoor humidity level as a percentage (0-100).

Required for `deviceType: 'THERMOSTAT'`

heatingCoolingSchedule.description:
Current indoor humidity level as a percentage (0-100).

Required for `deviceType: 'THERMOSTAT'`

generationRate.description:
Power currently being generated, measured in kW.

Required for `deviceType: 'SOLAR_INVERTER'`

totalEnergyProduced.description:
Total energy produced over a specified period, measured in kWh.

Required for `deviceType: 'SOLAR_INVERTER'`

dcInput.description:
DC perational data about solar inverters.

Required for `deviceType: 'SOLAR_INVERTER'`

voltage.description: DC voltage input from solar panels, measured in volts.

current.description: DC current input from solar panels, measured in amperes.

acOutput.description:
AC operational data about solar inverters.

Required for `deviceType: 'SOLAR_INVERTER'`

voltage.description: AC voltage output directed towards the grid or home, measured in volts.

current.description: DC current input from solar panels, measured in amperes.

efficiency.description:
Efficiency of the conversion process, represented as a percentage (0-100).

Required for `deviceType: 'SOLAR_INVERTER'`

solarInverterTemperature.description:
Real-time internal temperature of the solar inverter in Celsius.

Required for `deviceType: 'SOLAR_INVERTER'`

sunlightIntensity.description:
Intensity of sunlight captured by sensors, if available, measured in W/m^2.

Required for `deviceType: 'SOLAR_INVERTER'`

name.description: A custom name given to the location by the user, providing a meaningful and recognizable label.

gridLimit.description: Specifies the maximum power limit in watts (W) that can be delivered through the grid to the devices within the location. This parameter helps users manage and control the overall power consumption of the location.

devices.description: Allows users to associate specific devices with the newly created location. The devices parameter accepts an array of device IDs, enabling users to categorize and group their devices based on their physical location.

chargeDelayOverride.description: Indicates if the 3rd party has overridden the random charge delay required by regulations.

startTime.description: Start time of the charging period in ISO-8601 date format.

endTime.description: End time of the charging period in ISO-8601 date format.

energy.description: Amount of energy to be delivered during the charging period in watt-hours (Wh).
